title: External RAS network stack support
content:
The external RAS installer supports both IPv4 and IPv6-based network addresses. When a URL specifies a fully qualified domain name as the hostname, the selection of the appropriate network stack is controlled by the Domain Name System (DNS). Connection testing might be slow or unreliable.

Cause

This occurs due to improper DNS resolution caused by bad DNS settings.

Solution

To restrict the network stack to a preferred type, perform the following steps:
  1. Unpack the RAS installer.
  2. Extract the setup.exe file.
  3. Edit the install.bat file and remove the -b %BUNDLE_LOCATION% %* and add before -cp one of the following properties: 
    -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true (for IPv4) or
    -Djava.net.preferIPv6Stack=true (for IPv6).
  4. Save the file and run it from a command prompt.
